instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message:
This 3476 shows charge but it is not charging: "charging no". All other values seem ok and are recognized like total mah and cycle. Has orange light on the charger. I am out of options (that I know of). What I did so far:

- Tested different charger and battery
- Checked every resistor around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and battery connector
- Replaced <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and re-balled and then replaced SMS (both at least twice)
- Checked the battery data pullup resistors, proper ohm value and resistance

Anything else that could cause this symptom and I am overlooking?

Thanks!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no charge
threads.message: UPDATE: in a last ditch effort replaced the only thing that was left <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>, and charging.... just leaving this out here for the rest :) ticket is closed
